page.title: 10Oldmeldrum social life
page.content: For a town the size of Oldmeldrum (pop 1580, with approx 645 in the adjoining parishes of Meldrum and Bourtie), there is a well-organized social life. All ages are catered for and only one group, the Garioch Community Centre Kindergym, is of local government origin. For the elderly there are the Evergreens, the British Legion local branch, and the Church of Scotland Women's Guild. There are other church groups as well as local branches of the Red Cross WRVS the SWRI (Scottish Women's Rural Institute) and the Bridge Club. Scouts, Cubs and two Brownie packs cater for the young. Intellectual stimulus is provided by the Social Studies Group, the Literary Club and the Housewives' Register. As well as educating and entertaining, these clubs provide friendly venues for local people.
